verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> Hold<WH2790> not<WH408> thy peace, O God<WH430> of my praise;<WH8416>

Let his children<WH1121> be continually vagabonds,<WH5128> <WH5128> and beg:<WH7592> let them seek<WH1875> their bread also out of their desolate places.<WH4480> <WH2723>
Let the extortioner<WH5383> catch<WH5367> all<WH3605> that<WH834> he hath; and let the strangers<WH2114> spoil<WH962> his labor.<WH3018>
Let there be<WH1961> none<WH408> to extend<WH4900> mercy<WH2617> unto him: neither<WH408> let there be<WH1961> any to favor<WH2603> his fatherless children.<WH3490>
Let his posterity<WH319> be<WH1961> cut off;<WH3772> and in the generation<WH1755> following<WH312> let their name<WH8034> be blotted out.<WH4229>

Because <WH3282> that<WH834> he remembered<WH2142> not<WH3808> to show<WH6213> mercy,<WH2617> but persecuted<WH7291> the poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34> man,<WH376> that he might even slay<WH4191> the broken<WH3512> in heart.<WH3824>
As he loved<WH157> cursing,<WH7045> so let it come<WH935> unto him: as he delighted<WH2654> not<WH3808> in blessing,<WH1293> so let it be far<WH7368> from<WH4480> him.
As he clothed<WH3847> himself with cursing<WH7045> like as with his garment,<WH4055> so let it come<WH935> into his bowels<WH7130> like water,<WH4325> and like oil<WH8081> into his bones.<WH6106>
Let it be<WH1961> unto him as the garment<WH899> which covereth<WH5844> him, and for a girdle<WH4206> wherewith he is girded<WH2296> continually.<WH8548>
Let this<WH2063> be the reward<WH6468> of mine adversaries<WH7853> from<WH4480> <WH854> the LORD,<WH3068> and of them that speak<WH1696> evil<WH7451> against<WH5921> my soul.<WH5315>
But do<WH6213> thou<WH859> for<WH854> me, O GOD<WH3069> the Lord,<WH136> for thy name's sake:<WH4616> <WH8034> because<WH3588> thy mercy<WH2617> is good,<WH2896> deliver<WH5337> thou me.
For <WH3588> I<WH595> am poor<WH6041> and needy,<WH34> and my heart<WH3820> is wounded<WH2490> within<WH7130> me.
I am gone<WH1980> like the shadow<WH6738> when it declineth:<WH5186> I am tossed up and down<WH5287> as the locust.<WH697>
My knees<WH1290> are weak<WH3782> through fasting;<WH4480> <WH6685> and my flesh<WH1320> faileth<WH3584> of fatness.<WH4480> <WH8081>
I <WH589> became<WH1961> also a reproach<WH2781> unto them: when they looked upon<WH7200> me they shaked<WH5128> their heads.<WH7218>
Help <WH5826> me, O LORD<WH3068> my God:<WH430> O save<WH3467> me according to thy mercy: <WH2617>
That <WH3588> they may know<WH3045> that this<WH2063> is thy hand;<WH3027> that thou,<WH859> LORD,<WH3068> hast done<WH6213> it.
Let them<WH1992> curse,<WH7043> but bless<WH1288> thou:<WH859> when they arise,<WH6965> let them be ashamed;<WH954> but let thy servant<WH5650> rejoice.<WH8055>
Let mine adversaries<WH7853> be clothed<WH3847> with shame,<WH3639> and let them cover<WH5844> themselves with their own confusion,<WH1322> as with a mantle.<WH4598>
I will greatly<WH3966> praise<WH3034> the LORD<WH3068> with my mouth;<WH6310> yea, I will praise<WH1984> him among<WH8432> the multitude.<WH7227>
For <WH3588> he shall stand<WH5975> at the right hand<WH3225> of the poor,<WH34> to save<WH3467> him from those that condemn<WH4480> <WH8199> his soul.<WH5315>
